story.text: NEW YORK Jan 2 Southern California Edison's 1,080-megawatt San Onofre 3 nuclear power station in California was operating at 98 percent power early Tuesday, up from 65 percent of capacity early Friday, the U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission said in a power reactor status report. The unit, in San Clemente, California, about 60 miles north of San Diego, has been ramping up following a brief power reduction for repairs to a leaky pipe in the condensate system. Meanwhile, the adjacent 1,070-MW Unit 2 continued to run at 99 percent of capacity on Tuesday, the NRC report said. One MW powers about 700 homes in California. SoCal Edison, a subsidiary of Edison International (EIX.N) of Rosemead, California, operates the station for its owners and is a 75 percent shareholder. Other owners include Sempra Energy's (SRE.N) San Diego Gas & Electric subsidiary (20 percent) and the California cities of Riverside (2 percent) and Anaheim (3 percent).
story.title: socal edison san onofre reactor up to 98 pct power
